meanings.definition: The quality or state of being critical.
meanings.sent1: Her criticalness in evaluating the project helped improve its quality.
meanings.sent2: The criticalness of his feedback was appreciated by the team.
meanings.sent3: His criticalness in choosing a movie to watch always leads to interesting discussions.
meanings.sent4: The criticalness of a sharp knife in the kitchen cannot be overstated.
meanings.sent5: The criticalness of wearing a helmet while biking is for safety.

meanings.definition: The importance or urgency of a situation.
meanings.sent1: The criticalness of the matter required immediate attention.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the criticalness of the deadline, she worked diligently to meet it.
meanings.sent3: The criticalness of finding the right gift for her birthday made him nervous.
meanings.sent4: The criticalness of water in sustaining life is undeniable.
meanings.sent5: The criticalness of following safety procedures in the lab cannot be ignored.

meanings.definition: The tendency to make judgments or evaluations.
meanings.sent1: Her criticalness in analyzing the data led to valuable insights.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's criticalness in grading assignments ensures fairness.
meanings.sent3: His criticalness in choosing a restaurant always makes dining out an adventure.
meanings.sent4: The criticalness of a referee in a game is to ensure fair play.
meanings.sent5: The criticalness of a judge in a competition is to determine the winner.
